title: Cleveland Kiosk Delivers Virtual Health Care
teaser: The future of health care might be sitting in one of Cleveland's poorest neighborhoods. It's an enclosed kiosk where patients see a doctor.
contentencoded:
In a few states across the country, enclosed kiosks may become a go-to health care stop for patients who find it inconvenient to travel to doctor's office.

One example can be found in urban Cleveland, where WCPN's Sarah Jane Tribble found a fan of the virtual remote care.

  • Read more on this story via ideastream/WCPN

Reporter

  • Sarah Jane Tribble, health and health policy reporter for WCPN in Cleveland. She tweets @sjtribble.
